newsitem.title: USA: San Francisco commission backs Bay Bridge project.
newsitem.headline: San Francisco commission backs Bay Bridge project.

text.p: Transportation officials on Wednesday endorsed a plan that would raise $230 million to help replace the eastern span of the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge.
The Metropolitan Transportation Commission in Oakland voted overwhelmingly to approve the plan, which calls for a two-year extension of a toll increase on the Bay Bridge.

The additional toll revenues would generate an estimated $230 million to fund a small portion of the Bay Bridge replacement project. State lawmakers in Sacramento are negotiating ways to cover the bulk of the cost.
The commission said it hoped its proposal will be included in the state's final funding package.
The proposed single-deck, cable-supported eastern span would have 10 lanes with a single vertical tower, the commission said.
The commission is the transportation planning, financing and coordinating agency for the nine-county San Francisco Bay area.
